In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* the **spellbook of finger of death** can be [read](/wiki/Read "Read") to learn the **finger of death** spell. It is a level 7 [attack spell](/wiki/Attack_spell "Attack spell"), and the [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") takes roughly 80 turns to read.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, a [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") that is [crowned](/wiki/Crowned "Crowned"), does not already have the spellbook in their inventory, and is not wielding [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade") or [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") will receive a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") spellbook of finger of death.

## Description

The ray produced by this spell has the same effect as a [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death"): it instantly kills any monster it hits, unless the monster is [Death](/wiki/Riders#Death "Riders"), a [major demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon"), [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving"), or has [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") or [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"). Your [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in attack spells has no significant effect on finger of death, other than increasing the [spellcasting success rate](/wiki/Spellcasting#Calculating_spell_success_rate "Spellcasting") and to-hit probability.

[Zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") yourself directly with the spell is an [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath"), regardless of reflection or magic resistance, and is a [very bad idea](/wiki/Bad_idea "Bad idea").

## Strategy

The finger of death is the most difficult and magic-intensive spell in the game to learn, but this is to be expected given its extremely powerful effects. Since the spell is a ray, it can hit multiple enemies and bounce off walls, and is subject to reflection. Be *extremely* careful about casting it without having reflection or magic resistance yourself.

It is most useful for being able to instantly kill most of the monsters in the game, if they are not resistant - unfortunately most of the nastier late-game enemies *are*. [Archons](/wiki/Archon "Archon") do not technically resist it, but since they are always generated with a [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), they will never be affected unless the shield is somehow swapped or removed. [Minotaurs](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur") are a good candidate for this spell, and it is also generally good for crowd control, since it can take out multiple monsters per casting. It can also take out the [high priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") of Moloch if they do not generate with a [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance"), and can be used against the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") provided he does not steal a [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") or obtain another item that gives him magic resistance.

## Origin

The finger of death appears as the ultimate spell in the old game [Spellcast](http://www.eblong.com/zarf/spellcast.html), also known as *[Spellbinder](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spellbinder_\(paper-and-pencil_game\) "wikipedia:Spellbinder (paper-and-pencil game)")* or *Waving Hands*.
